WorkItem.Description:
Upgraded to 2.3.17, loaded my warrior from the armory and was surprised to see the Tier10 (amongst other things) missing from certain gear slots. Searching the issues I saw the comment about adjusting my filters. Which I did, but still the the Tier10 items are missing. 
 
The example I present is for the head slot on a protection warrior. 
 
I assume the Sanctified [Ymirjar Lord's Greathelm] should be considered an upgrade to the [Headplate of the Honorbound]. 
 
Wowhead isn't the end all of gear comparisons but here is a link comparing the 2 items: http://www.wowhead.com/compare?items=51218;47678
The [Ymirjar Lord's Greathelm] looks like a upgrade to me!
 
 
Attached is a screenshot of my filters, Head slot, Sorted: Overall.
 
 I assume the [Ymirjar Lord's Greathelm] are in the Tier10 Raids (10/25) ICC area.  Maybe they are in another area?
 
Thanks for your time.

Comments.Message: Please make use of the Issue Tracker and Discussions. This has already been answered many times.
Although your screenshot shows "Emblem of Frost" as selected, I will bet money the 2 subfilters "Class Tokens" and "Other" are not checked.

Thank you for the quick response, but it's not very helpful. I browsed the first 5 pages of issues and did not see this issue listed. I searched for "missing upgrades", "missing equipment", "bad filters" and did not get any hits in the issue tracker that I thought was related to my problem. I searched the FAQ for an answer and did not find it. *If* it has indeed been answered "many" times isn't that the definition of FAQ?  Instead of a terse "... you are an idiot! RTFM! ..." response, why not link the Issue Tracker, Discussion threads, and FAQ URLs in your comment?

Brituck is correct, the 2 subfilters were not checked. That solved the problem. Knowing the solution help me figure out why I was failing on the searches in the Issue Tracker. The default is "Open Issues". When I switched it to "All Issues" I found related tickets.
Seriously, some people need to L2Read. We do occasionally say things like "... you are an idiot! RTFM! ...". This wasn't one of those times. Quit feeling like people are 'against' you somehow.
